attributes.action: Crimilisation of clients who buy sex
attributes.additional_details:
Call upon the Government to follow the example of Sweden, Norway, Iceland and France to criminalise all clients of sex workers, meaning anyone who buys sex from any kind of prostitute would face a prison and a fine as any visit to a prostitute encourages slavery and trafficking.

In the UK Bolton police have successfully run a campaign to stop prostitution, Inspector Phil Spurgeon says, "In the 21st centuary, how can you have a town where you turn a blind eye to the exploitation of women and young children?'
